alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 25 at 10:49AM PST until January 26 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Elevated surf of 4 to 6 feet with dangerous rip currents. Surf will be highest on west-facing beaches. * WHERE...Ventura County Coast. * WHEN...Through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning due to the dangerous conditions. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
